oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE HEIGHT DISTRIBUTIONS IN SHALLOW WATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mai, Stephan
Wilhelmi, Jens
Barjenbruch, Ulrich
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave height statistics
radar measurement
shallow water
Battjes-Groenendijk / Rayleigh distribution
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
In shallow waters the wave height distribution significantly differs from Rayleigh distribution during extreme wind conditions. The EurOtop manual (Pullen et al. 2007) recommends the use of a composite Rayleigh-Weibull distribution proposed by Battjes and Groenendijk (2000) in order to describe the wave statistics in shallow waters. A test of this recommendation by using wave measurements with continuously operated radar level gauges at three different sites at the German North Sea coast for comparison revealed the necessity for a change in the parameterization given in the EurOtop manual.
